entry.title: Disabling nap app
entry.content:
Since Mavericks there is a feature called Nap app.

For some reason it can be better to prevent an application to take a nap.

Tip

You can disable this for a specific application.

defaults write com.apple.Terminal NSAppSleepDisabled -bool YES

The Manual Solution:

Mavericks comes with a dreaded feature — App Nap – that is designed to save battery live and be energy star compliant. Fine for some apps – but it doesn’t really work if you are using Studio as a web server. You can manually turn it off by: – doing a ‘get info’ on Studio and – clicking the ‘disable app nap’ feature.

you’ll get all your studio horses firing on all cylinders even in the background – which is what you want.

Disable nap app

entry.title: How to fix slow startup osx mountain lion
entry.content:
I recently experienced very slow startup of my iMac and it seemed related to heavy Spotlight indexing. I researched this item on Google but I could not find a real Root cause.

I made a call to Apple support and I got the following suggestions:

  1. Goto to Finder
  2. Press Alt
  3. Goto Library
  4. Move folder Caches to the trash
  5. Move folder LaunchAgents to the trash
  6. Goto folder Preferences
  7. Move com.apple.spotlight.plist to the desktop
  8. restart

This resulted in my iMac performing as usual.

So it worked for me.

Be careful and make a backup before trying this fix.

No guarantees!
